headline: How Investors May Respond To Walmart (WMT) E-commerce Strength And New US$30 Billion Buyback Plan
summary: In recent days, Walmart reported full-year 2026 results showing higher sales, revenue, and net income, approved a US$0.99 per-share annual dividend for fiscal 2027, completed a US$16.14 billion buyback program and authorized a new US$30 billion repurchase plan, while brands like Smash Kitchen and Catalyst Pet announced nationwide product launches at its stores. Taken together, these updates highlight Walmart’s effort to pair technology-led e-commerce growth and an expanding product ecosystem...

headline: California seeks injunction to stop Amazon's alleged stifling of price competition
summary: California asked a state judge on Tuesday to stop Amazon.com from inflating prices for consumers through an ‌alleged campaign to bully merchants not to sell goods more cheaply elsewhere.  The ‌state's attorney general, Rob Bonta, sought a preliminary injunction in his 3-1/2-year-old antitrust lawsuit against ​Amazon, which also seeks to recoup ill-gotten profits.  "Amazon’s goal is to insulate itself from price competition by preventing lower retail prices in the market," Bonta said in a heavily redacted filing in the California Superior Court in San Francisco.

raw.headline: California seeks injunction to stop Amazon's alleged stifling of price competition

"Amazon’s goal is to insulate itself from price competition by preventing lower retail prices in the market," Bonta said in a heavily redacted filing in the California Superior Court in San Francisco.
